VLIB Function Reference

Non-Maximal Suppression (mask output)

Introduction and Use Cases

Vision algorithms such as Harris Corner detection produce an intensity map or voting space for which the local maxima or peaks need to be found.

Specification

Variants

This functionality is available in three variants:
  • 3 16-bit versions: 3x3, 5x5, 7x7

Note that there is also a list output version: Non-Maximal Suppression (list output). It is not listed on this page because the API and method is sufficiently different. Primary differences are:

  • Mask output version produces an output which is a byte mask of the peaks (255 for peaks, and 0 for non-peaks), whereas the list output version produces an output which is a list of coordinates (y,x) where the peaks are located.
  • Mask output version has fixed functions for 3x3, 5x5, 7x7 kernel sizes, whereas the list output version is a single function with programmable parameter for filter size (3x3, 5x5, 7x7).
  • Mask output version has only has functionality for 16-bit inputs, whereas the list output version has variants for both 16-bit input and 32-bit input.

Inputs


    Parameter          Description                                   16-bit
    ------------------------------------------------------------------------
    *im                Input image                                  (SQ15.0)
     width             Image width                                  (SQ31.0)
     height            Image height                                 (SQ31.0)
     thresh            Minimum threshold for peaks                  (SQ15.0)
    *out               Binary output indicating peaks               (UQ8.0)

Outputs

    Returns VLIB Error Status

Method

This function compares the value of each input pixel against its neighbors. For an output pixel to be "on" (numerical value=255), the input pixel value must be both:
  • Greater than or equal to its neighbors values
  • Greater than the minimum threshold

If the above conditions are not met simultaneously, the output will be 0.

APIS

  • VLIB_nonMaxSuppress_3x3_S16
  • VLIB_nonMaxSuppress_5x5_S16
  • VLIB_nonMaxSuppress_7x7_S16
